title: Margot Robbie Interview: Kissing Leonardo DiCaprio, plus Tarzan details!

json.text: -I'm Andrea from ITN. Lovely to meet you. -Lovely to meet you too.
-Congratulations! -Thank you. Thanks so much.
How does it feel holding that award?
It's really... It's a lot heavier than I expected. It's really cool though. I've never won any
like award or any trophy or anything, so this is great.
Growing up though, I can imagine. Did you do practising the acceptance speech in the mirror?
Oh absolutely, and in my head it went so much more smoothly than it just did before because
I'm pretty sure I just started stuttering and mumbling, so yeah. I clearly didn't get
enough practice. I should have done more practising in the mirror with a hairbrush or something.
I'm sure it was brilliant. Now Wolf of Wall Street. Wow, that has thrown you into a completely
different realm of fame. How's life been after the movie? The feedback's obviously been amazing.
I guess it hasn't changed too many things. I'm just a lot busier I suppose, which is
a wonderful problem. I've just got a lot more opportunities than I did before, which is
just unbelievable. So yeah, I'm really lucky in getting a chance to work with people I
really, really want to work with. So it's amazing.
-Leonardo DiCaprio. -Yeah, yeah.
What is he like as a kisser? Was it weird?
No, he's great. He's so professional that he never makes anything feel weird on set.
It's just easy, yeah.
Now, we were gutted he didn't win the Oscar. I think he totally deserved it with that film.
But was he alright about it? Because it's a bit of a running joke that he hasn't won
one yet because he's so incredible.
Yeah, no he's such a humble guy that he would never be a bad sport about those things. I
think he's just happy for the people that do get recognised, and I think he's just grateful
to be nominated and there and things like that. He's really... He doesn't have a big
ego, despite his big profile I suppose.
-Now, I heard you've moved to London. -Yeah!
Are you enjoying the city so far?
I love it. I've always loved London. It's one of my favourite cities so I'm so happy to be here.
What do you like most about the city? Have you done a bit of sightseeing?
I've done that all in the past. I guess what I like most are my roommates. I just have
the most awesome roommates.
Oh my God! Like how many roommates do you have?
There's six of us in a four bedroom house. Yeah, it's a bit crazy. There's four London
boys and two Aussie girls, so it's a really fun group.
Now Tarzan. Playing Jane, a dream role. Tell me how that came about. Is that something
quite recent?
Yeah, it's very recent. We start in a couple months, and you know, just the usual,
got the script, loved it. Met with David Yates, the director. Loved him and his vision for
the film and all the pieces came together. Luckily, I got picked for the role, so yeah.
Very lucky.
I'm loving the new brunette locks. Is that for the role?
No, I just did a film where I had brown hair, and then we went a shade darker just for Oscars
and things like that... It was a really manky brown colour, and it looked kind of awful.
It was meant to look awful in film, so we made it just a nicer, richer colour, but now
I've got to start going lighter again for Tarzan.
Do blondes have more fun, do you think?
Everyone's asking that. I love this hair colour. I don't think blondes have more fun, no. And
we've got ask you. How do you stay in shape? We saw you do a little ballet. Is that something you're really into?
Yeah, I just got an Instagram and I posted this picture from Ballet Bodies, where I see
my trainer there, and it's like pilates with ballet techniques, so whenever I'm in LA,
I see her. Yeah, I love it.
And one last question. We've obviously got Tom Cruise and Arnie here tonight. Are you
going to try to get a quick selfie do you think?
I'm not huge on the whole selfies thing.
Are you not?
No, I feel like a real dickhead doing that. I'm getting better at it now that I've got
like social media, I suppose. It goes hand in hand, so I definitely would never ask them
-for a selfie though. -Not a selfie queen.
No, God no. That makes me cringe a little bit.
Well congratulations and have a great night.
-Thanks so much. -Celebrate!
Absolutely.
